704275f-a.text:
(1)
Flatbush Ave., east side, between Church and Snyder Aves. A view of the original Erasmus Hall H.S. built in 1786. This building is in back of the new High School. This school was built by private subscription. Both Hamilton and Burr contributed. It became a Public School in 1896.
1914.
Eugene L. Armbruster, Collection.
(2)
The same, showing a rear view of old Erasmus Hall Academy as viewed
from Snyder Ave.
March 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
704275f-a.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Church Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

704273f-a.text:
(1)
Flatbush Ave., west side, south of Church Ave. The view shows The First Dutch Reformed Church of Flatbush, built in 1793.
1914.
Eugene L. Armbruster, Collection.
(2)
The same, showing another view of the church, erected on the site of
two other churches built in 1654-1656 and 1699.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(3)
The same, another view.
April 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
704273f-a.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Church Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

704276f-a.text:
(1)
900 Flatbush Ave., near the S.W. corner of Church Ave., showing at
right, a view of the Parsonage, since removed.
1917.

(2)
The same, showing a full view of the parsonage.
About January 1917.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

704272f-b.text:
(1)
Flatbush Ave., at Church Ave., showing in the background, and at the left, Flatbush and Church Aves., respectively. Also seen is the cemetery of the Flatbush Dutch Reformed Church, and the church viewed
from East 21st Street.
April 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, showing a side view and the east side of Flatbush
Ave.
April 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(3)
The same, showing the church on Flatbush Ave.
May 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

704274f-a.text:
Flatbush Ave., east side, between Church and Snyder Aves. A view of Erasmus Hall Academy built in 1786 at a cost of $6,250. It was incorporated in November 1787 and was transferred to the City of Brooklyn in 1896. The first principal was the Rev. John
H. Livingston.
August 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, at a slightly different angle.
August, 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(3)
The same, another view.
August, 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(4)
The same.
August, 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
704274f-a.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Church Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

704271f-a.text:
Flatbush Avenue, at the S. W. corner of Church Avenue, showing the Flatbush Dutch Reformed Church, built 1793-6.
July, 1934
S. Landsman
704271f-a.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Church Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

704280f-b.text:
(1)
920 Flatbush Ave., west side, between Church and Snyder Aves., showing the Judge John A. Lott house, erected on land purchased from Barent Van Deventer and the Township of Flatbush, on which once stood the Van Deventer farmhouse and part of the Flatbush Court House, about 1836. In 1915, the Midwood Association purchased it, in 1923 it was partly destroyed by fire and shortly thereafter it was demolished.
1922.
Eugene L Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, a closer view.
April 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
704280f-b.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Church Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
